resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5867#discussion_r348042524
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py
 ##########
 @@ -3353,6 +3343,13 @@ def test_convert_to_extension_array(monkeypatch):
     assert isinstance(result._data.blocks[0], _int.ExtensionBlock)
     tm.assert_frame_equal(result, df2)
 
+    # # monkeypatch pandas Int64Dtype to *not* have the protocol method
+    # monkeypatch.delattr(pd.Int64Dtype, "__from_arrow__")
 
 Review comment:
   Still looking into how to get this working (it seems a problem on the pandas side), as it would be nice to still have a test for the case that a pandas ExtensionDtype does not have this `__from_arrow__` method

pitrou commented on pull request #5867: ARROW-7209: [Python] Fix tests on pandas master related to extension dtype conversion
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5867#discussion_r348477561
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py
 ##########
 @@ -3353,6 +3343,13 @@ def test_convert_to_extension_array(monkeypatch):
     assert isinstance(result._data.blocks[0], _int.ExtensionBlock)
     tm.assert_frame_equal(result, df2)
 
+    # monkeypatch pandas Int64Dtype to *not* have the protocol method
+    monkeypatch.delattr(pd.core.arrays.integer._IntegerDtype, "__from_arrow__")
+    # Int64Dtype has no __arrow_array__ -> use normal conversion
 
 Review comment:
   Should be `__from_arrow__`, no?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #5867: ARROW-7209: [Python] Fix tests on pandas master related to extension dtype conversion
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5867#discussion_r348477954
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py
 ##########
 @@ -3374,10 +3371,7 @@ def test_conversion_extensiontype_to_extensionarray(monkeypatch):
     arr = pa.ExtensionArray.from_storage(MyCustomIntegerType(), storage)
     table = pa.table({'a': arr})
 
-    with pytest.raises(ValueError):
-        table.to_pandas()
-
-    # patch pandas Int64Dtype to have the protocol method
+    # ensure pandas Int64Dtype has the protocol method (for older pandas)
 
 Review comment:
   Whould we monkey-patch selectively (only if Pandas is old enough)?

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5867: ARROW-7209: [Python] Fix tests on pandas master related to extension dtype conversion
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5867#discussion_r348545233
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py
 ##########
 @@ -3374,10 +3371,7 @@ def test_conversion_extensiontype_to_extensionarray(monkeypatch):
     arr = pa.ExtensionArray.from_storage(MyCustomIntegerType(), storage)
     table = pa.table({'a': arr})
 
-    with pytest.raises(ValueError):
-        table.to_pandas()
-
-    # patch pandas Int64Dtype to have the protocol method
+    # ensure pandas Int64Dtype has the protocol method (for older pandas)
 
 Review comment:
   > Whould we monkey-patch selectively (only if Pandas is old enough)?
   
   The problem is that the cut-off is somewhere in current master (not yet released). Although, since we only care about *latest* master, that should actually be doable, yes.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

fields.description: I implemented pandas <-> arrow roundtrip for pandas' integer+string dtype in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/29483, which is now merged. But our tests where assuming this did not yet work in pandas, and thus need to be updated.
fields.summary: [Python] tests with pandas master are failing now __from_arrow__ support landed in pandas
